page.title: List of reportedly haunted locations in Romania

revision.comment: added [[Category:Lists of reportedly haunted locations]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=December 2015}} There are numerous '''reportedly haunted locations in [[Romania]]'''. This list sorts these places alphabetically by county, and then alphabetically within each county.
== Argeș County ==
*'''Trivale Forest in [[Pitești]]''' - There is a legend about a maiden, daughter of a rich landowner, who loved a poor servant of her father. Her father found an old rich man for her to marry, but during the wedding day, she ran with the servant in the forest. Her father found them and killed her lover and then dacapitated her. It is generally accepted that the two scary things about the forest are: the decapitated ghost of the bride and the people going in the forest to do satanic rituals.<ref>http://adevarul.ro/locale/pitesti/legendele-mireselor-moarte-casabantuita-padurea-trivale-1_5513ca91448e03c0fdec20a5/index.html</ref>
== Bacău County == * '''Zarifopol Mansion in [[Filipești]]''' – Called by locals "the House of Evil",<ref>{{cite web |url=http://cultural.bzi.ro/casa-raului-din-inima-moldovei-2969 |title=Casa Răului din inima Moldovei |work=Bună Ziua Iași |date=31 July 2013 |language=Romanian}}</ref> the mansion is the site of several reports of paranormal activities: indistinct voices, bizarre sounds, steps, cold currents which "walk" through walls.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.romaniatv.net/romania-mistica-casa-raului-de-pe-raul-precista_73230.html |title=ROMÂNIA MISTICĂ. Casa Răului de pe râul Precista |work=România TV |author=Narcisa Tomulescu |date=30 March 2013 |language=Romanian}}</ref>
== Bucharest == [[File:Mănăstirea Chiajna - Giulești.jpg|thumb|200px|The ruins of [[Chiajna Monastery]] near Giulești-Sârbi]] [[File:Hotel cismigiu door 2012.JPG|thumb|200px|Main entrance to Cișmigiu Hotel]] [[File:Bucuresti, Romania, Casa Vernescu, Calea Victoriei nr. 133, sect. 1, (holul 2).JPG|thumb|200px|Interior of Vernescu House]] * '''Bazilescu Park''' – Also known as [[Nicolae Bălcescu]] Park, Bazilescu Park is located in Bucureștii Noi neighborhood. Within the park is the Summer Theatre, built in 1953. During the night, in the area can be heard strident sounds and the cough of a man (whereof it is said that belongs to Bazilescu), coming from beyond the columns of the derelict theatre.<ref name="bucuresti">{{cite web |url=http://stiri.tvr.ro/fantomele-din-bucuresti-case-bantuite-demoni-si-legende-urbane_45454.html |title=Fantomele din Bucureşti. Case bântuite, demoni şi legende urbane |work=Ştirile TVR |date=2 June 2014 |language=Romanian}}</ref> * '''Central Girls School''' – Inside this historical building and its courtyard have been reports of strange sounds, cold breeze and fetid odors, but were also seen levitating objects, doors and windows that open and close without any human intervention.<ref name="bucuresti" /> * '''[[Chiajna Monastery]]''' – This ruined monastery has its root somewhere in the 18th century, during the rule of [[Alexandru Ipsilanti]]. It was a big monastery, with thick walls, reason for that the Turks "confused" it and assaulted it. Moreover, some historical sources show that between its walls died of plague the Metropolitan of Wallachia, Cozma. The land and the building have never got to be sanctified. For these reasons it was abandoned, and the monastery's bell was thrown in the [[Dâmbovița River]], people blaming it cursed and leaving it in ruins.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.financiarul.ro/2013/12/04/istoria-zbuciumata-a-manastirii-chiajna-un-loc-plin-de-legende-si-fenomene-stranii/ |title=Istoria zbuciumată a Mănăstirii Chiajna, un loc plin de legende și fenomene stranii |work=Financiarul |date=4 December 2013 |language=Romanian}}</ref> According to locals, the bell can still be heard ringing on full moon nights, many audio records proving this fact.<ref name="rtv">{{cite web |url=http://www.romaniatv.net/romania-mistica-manastirea-chiajna-bizar-bucuresti_52719.html |title=ROMÂNIA MISTICĂ. Mănăstirea Chiajna, străjerul bizar al Bucureștiului |work=România TV |date=10 November 2012 |language=Romanian}}</ref> Moreover, it is said that on one of the walls near the entrance can be glimpsed the face of a beautiful lady, which is said to be Ancuța, the daughter of Mrs. Chiajna, who would have been killed on the orders of her mother after she ran with her beloved without her mother's approval.<ref name="rtv" /> On top of that, in the area would have been several murders and numerous mysterious disappearances.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.historia.ro/exclusiv_web/actualitate/articol/blestemul-clopotului-ingropat-manastirea-chiajna |title=Blestemul clopotului îngropat la Mănăstirea Chiajna |work=Historia.ro |author=Cătălina Slujitoru, Maria Apostol |language=Romanian}}</ref> * '''Cișmigiu Hotel''' – The building was closed in 1970 and reopened in 1990, when it was converted into hostel for students of the Faculty of Theatre and Film.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.efemeride.ro/top-5-locuri-bantuite-din-bucuresti |title=Top 5 locuri bântuite din București |work=Efemeride |date=25 December 2013 |language=Romanian}}</ref> Legend says that in a weekend, when all the students were away on vacation, a young woman from [[Moldova]] was raped and then thrown into the elevator shaft. She died there, after three hours she desperately cried for help, with no one to hear her. Many say that her screams can still be heard.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.historia.ro/exclusiv_web/general/articol/cele-mai-bantuite-locuri-bucuresti |title=Cele mai bântuite locuri din București |work=Historia.ro |author=Florin Stoican |language=Romanian}}</ref> * '''Hospital of the Posts''' – Previously housed in the building behind the [[Stavropoleos Church]], Hospital of the Posts was a site of [[organ trafficking]]. It is said that, especially in long winter nights, can be heard on adjacent streets groans and cries of those who died on hospital beds.<ref name="bucuresti" /> * '''"House of the Devil" on General Praporgescu Street''' – The house, which now looks degraded, is distinguished by the ivy that covers it entirely. It is the site of two tragic events: in the interwar period, a man would have killed here two women, and within a few years, a young woman would have committed suicide.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://metropotam.ro/Locuri-de-vizitat/Legende-urbane-Casele-diavolului-din-Bucuresti-art6780873753/ |title=Legende urbane: Casele diavolului din București |work=Metropotam.ro |date=6 December 2010 |language=Romanian}}</ref> Some say that in full moon nights on one of the walls of the house can be seen the number [[666]], symbol of the devil, and here would live a demonic entity full of hate and anger, that can be felt from afar.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.realitatea.net/foto-cum-a-ajuns-o-vila-din-bucure-ti-sa-fie-casa-diavolului_1520723.html |title=Cum a ajuns o vilă din București să fie CASA DIAVOLULUI! |work=Realitatea.net |date=9 September 2014 |language=Romanian}}</ref> * '''Orphanage on the French Street''' – Legend says the house, located at number 13, is haunted by no less than 203 children's spirits. In this orphanage were brought homeless children, even by its owner – Stavrache Hagi-Orman. He kept the kids in unimaginable conditions, without water and without food. After dozens of children died of starvation, the orphanage was closed. Locals reported voices of children crying "Water, we want water!".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://adevarul.ro/news/bucuresti/cele-mai-infricosatoare-mituri-urbane-bucuresti-orfelinatul-bantuit-centrul-istoric-placinta-carne-om-1_511a74ff344a782118318ec5/index.html |title=Cele mai înfricoșătoare mituri urbane din București. Orfelinatul bântuit din Centrul Istoric și plăcinta cu carne de om |work=Adevărul |author=Bogdan Păvăloi |date=13 February 2013 |language=Romanian}}</ref> * '''Vernescu House on the Victory Avenue''' – It is named by locals "Cellar of the Devil" ({{lang-ro|Hruba lui Scaraoțchi}}). Here still operate a [[casino]]. It is said that in the past century, several players committed suicide inside the house after they lost the entire fortunes at roulette. Reports indicate three ghosts that haunt the house. They shake the furniture, cause air currents and sometimes even appear on the hallways of the building. Passers also reported strong odor of sulfur in the building's yard.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/romania-pitoreasca/secretele-intunecate-ale-bucurestiului-tuneluri-ascunse-si-povesti-despre-cladiri-bantuite.html |title=Secretele Bucureștiului. Legendele din Centrul Vechi al Capitalei |work=Știrile Pro TV |date=8 May 2013 |language=Romanian}}</ref> * '''Witches' Pond''' – According to the legend, the pond located in Boldu-Crețeasca Forest, having a diameter of only 5 m, is the place were [[Vlad the Impaler]] was beheaded.<ref name="protv">{{cite web |url=http://stirileprotv.ro/stiri/romania-pitoreasca/balta-vrajitoarelor-un-loc-plin-de-legende-si-fenomene-bizare-intr-o-padure-de-langa-bucuresti.html |title="Balta Vrăjitoarelor". Un loc plin de legende și fenomene bizare, într-o pădure de lângă București |work=Știrile Pro TV |date=7 May 2013 |language=Romanian}}</ref> It is said that after the [[1977 Vrancea earthquake|1977 earthquake]] many trucks unloaded debris in the pond, with the aim of stoppering it. Within weeks, the debris disappeared in its waters, although the pond has a depth of only one meter and a half. Locals say that many times when pregnant women didn't want the child went to the pond, bathed and ridded the pregnancy. Even the animals would be scared of this place: there would be no frog or any being that lives in the pond, and the animals don't drink water from there. The pond is famous for the gipsy witches that gather each year to Sânziene, St. George and St. Andrew to practice their magic rituals.<ref name="protv" /> Near this eye of water have been observed over time strange phenomena, like globular lightnings or storms started suddenly. The pond never change, doesn't dry, doesn't expand, whether it rains or is drought.<ref name="protv" /> In a video from mid-90s is shown a strange phenomenon: in midsummer, on an area of some square meters it snowed, immediately after a woman from the stunt team was terribly amused while trying to put a helmet on the head of a mannequin that portrayed Vlad the Impaler.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.romaniatv.net/romania-mistica-balta-vrajitoarelor-din-padurea-boldu-creteasca-o-poarta-catre-alta-lume_51742.html |title=ROMÂNIA MISTICĂ. Balta Vrăjitoarelor, din pădurea Boldu-Crețeasca, o poartă către altă lume |work=România TV |author=Narcisa Tomulescu |date=3 November 2012 |language=Romanian}}</ref>
== Călărași County == * '''Călugăreasca Forest''' – It is a forest of [[mulberry tree]]s, where it is said that the wind never blows. Here, people say that existed a monastery of monks, but they were killed by the Turks, and the place was made one with the earth by the pagans.<ref name="calugareasca">{{cite web |url=http://www.romaniatv.net/romania-mistica-tainele-baraganului-blestemul-comorilor-si-padurea-calugareasca_49733.html |title=ROMÂNIA MISTICĂ. Tainele Bărăganului: blestemul comorilor și pădurea Călugăreasca |work=România TV |author=Narcisa Tomulescu |date=20 October 2012 |language=Romanian}}</ref> The last monk killed by the Turkish army threw a curse upon them. So that, after death, the spirits of those who have defiled hands with the blood of the monks returned in thickets of Călugăreasca, from where they never found the way out.<ref name="calugareasca" /> At the edge of the forest are also a lot of crosses, which legend says that stand sentry as the pagans' spirits can not escape. People are reluctant to seek the thickets of Călugăreasca due to the curses, and the only safe place in the woods was the large white cross that reminds about the monastery and that protects those who pray next to it when the night catches them in the grove.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.formula-as.ro/2007/778/societate-37/misterul-din-padurea-calugareasca-8160 |title=Misterul din pădurea Calugăreasca |work=Formula AS |language=Romanian}}</ref>
== Cluj County == [[File:Anexa castelul Banffy.JPG|thumb|200px|[[Bonțida Bánffy Castle|Bánffy Castle]] in renovation]] [[File:Cluj-Napoca - Hoia Forest and Grigorescu district.jpg|thumb|200px|The southern slope of Hoia Hill and [[Grigorescu, Cluj-Napoca|Grigorescu District]] of [[Cluj-Napoca]]]] * '''[[Bonțida Bánffy Castle|Bánffy Castle]]''' in [[Bonțida]] – Dubbed "the Versailles of Transylvania", the castle is reportedly haunted by the ghost of a young servant who paid with his life because he revealed that his mistress deceived her husband.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://ziuadecj.realitatea.net/eveniment/castelul-bantuit-din-bontida-a-ajuns-celebru-in-toata-lumea-video--116236.html |title=Castelul "bântuit" din Bonțida a ajuns celebru în toată lumea |work=Ziua de Cluj |date=27 August 2013 |language=Romanian}}</ref> Another variant is that the place is haunted by the ghosts of those who died in Bánffy during the [[Second World War]], when the castle was converted by Germans into a military hospital. Legend says that there were often seen sinister shadows that seemed to be of some soldiers, while through walls were heard strange noises, groans, sounds of footsteps or indistinct voices.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.romaniatv.net/romania-mistica-fantomele-de-la-castelul-banffy_63580.html |title=ROMÂNIA MISTICĂ. Fantomele de la Castelul Bánffy |work=România TV |author=Narcisa Tomulescu |date=26 January 2013 |language=Romanian}}</ref> * '''[[Hoia Forest]]''' – The forest near [[Cluj-Napoca]] has long been known for the mysterious events that take place here and was even cataloged as a gateway to another dimension.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hoiabaciuforest.com/ |title=Hoia Baciu Forest – World's Most Haunted Forest |work=Hoia Baciu Forest}}</ref> Dubbed "the Bermuda Triangle of Transylvania", the forest is one of the most active areas of the world in terms of paranormal phenomena. Legends would have occurred, it seems, after a shepherd disappeared into the forest along with his 200 sheep and no one managed to find neither he nor any part of the flock.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://adevarul.ro/locale/cluj-napoca/legendele-socat-capitala-ardealuluiunde-regele-ungariei-matia-corvinul-fost-biciut-avram-iancu-s-a-batut-instudentie-1_511b3eaa344a78211834c004/index.html |title=Legendele care au șocat capitala Ardealului. Monștrii marini din Tarnița și poveștile despre Pădurea Hoia, una dintre cele mai bântuite păduri din lume |work=Adevărul |author=Florina Pop |date=13 February 2013 |language=Romanian}}</ref> It was only the first mysterious disappearance that took place in the forest. People who accidentally pass right through active areas report skin burns, redness, irritations, headaches, amplified sensation of thirst, anxiety, sensation of fainting.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.descopera.ro/fenomenele-paranormale/4630685-ce-se-afla-in-padurea-baciu |title=Ce se află în pădurea Baciu? |work=Descoperă.ro |author=Nicu Parlog |date=15 July 2009 |language=Romanian}}</ref> Hoia Forest became famous in the world after on 18 August 1968, military technician Emil Barnea photographed in the Round Glade ({{lang-ro|Poiana Rotundă}}) an UFO, the photos being among the few of this kind genuine, according to experts. Numerous accounts of villagers reported unexplained physical sensations, observations of various shapes and colors lights, strange shadows, voices and human faces.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/travel/2013/oct/29/halloween-holiday-top-10-scariest-europe |title=A Halloween holiday? The top 10 creepiest spots in Europe |work=The Guardian |author=Mark Pickering |date=29 October 2013}}</ref> The local vegetation is often bizarre.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.antena3.ro/life-show/bizar/padurea-hoia-baciu-de-langa-cluj-centrul-fenomenelor-paranormale-video-104339.html |title=Pădurea Hoia-Baciu, de lângă Cluj – centrul fenomenelor paranormale |work=Antena 3 |date=26 July 2010 |language=Romanian}}</ref> The trees have strange shapes, even human faces can be depicted from their trunks. In 2000, Alexandru Pătruț, President of the Romanian Society of Parapsychology, caught a strange phenomenon in the forest, around the Easter: a kind of sap flowed profusely from the top of the trees.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://adevarul.ro/locale/cluj-napoca/video-misterele-padurea-hoia-baciu-triunghiul-romanesc-bermudelor-dematerializari-aeroforme-bioforme-ozn-uri-1_50ae5b9f7c42d5a6639c0806/index.html |title=Misterele din Pădurea Hoia-Baciu, "Triunghiul românesc al Bermudelor": dematerializări, aeroforme, bioforme, OZN-uri |work=Adevărul |author=Monika Krajnik |date=16 April 2012 |language=Romanian}}</ref> Next day, everything was dry. He also reported strange sounds of ambulance sirens, tire exploding and even cuckoo clock. The forest was included in top 15 most haunted places in the world by the American magazine ''[[Travel+Leisure]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.travelandleisure.com/articles/worlds-most-haunted-forests/7 |title=World's Most Haunted Forests |work=Travel+Leisure |author=Bree Sposato |date=October 2012}}</ref>
== Constanța County ==
*'''Tomis Nord neighbourhood from [[Constanța]]''' Supposedly, the neighbourhood is haunted by a woman who was decapitated by her husband who believed that he was cheated on.<ref>[http://www.replicaonline.ro/fenomene-stranii-in-cartierul-tomis-nord-constantenii-povestesc-despre-o-femeie-care-bantuie-zona-215733/ Fenomene STRANII în cartierul Tomis Nord! Constănţenii povestesc despre o femeie care bântuie zona<!-- Titlu generat de robot -->]</ref>
== Dâmbovița County == * '''Bride's Trinity on [[DN7]]''' – On national road DN7, near the town of [[Găești]], there is a monument called Bride's Trinity or Margareta's Trinity. Here it is said that on 24 September 1936,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://cronica-gaestiului.ro/archives/92 |title=Povestea cutremurătoare a miresei moarte în ziua nunții ei |work=Cronica de Găești |author=Mariana Ionescu |date=15 November 2011 |language=Romanian}}</ref> Margareta Ștefănescu died in a car accident, even on her wedding day, and since then the place has become cursed.<ref name="mireasa">{{cite web |url=http://www.romaniatv.net/romania-mistica-descopera-blestemul-mireselor-moarte_44584.html |title=ROMÂNIA MISTICĂ. Descoperă blestemul mireselor moarte |work=România TV |author=Narcisa Tomulescu |date=15 September 2012 |language=Romanian}}</ref> In the area have occurred a lot of fatal crashes, even if the road is straight and with maximum visibility. The road was "baptized" by locals "the Road of Crosses". In the road tragedies are involved especially men. For example, only in 2008–09 in that place 12 young men died, mostly unmarried. Likewise, there were several reports of a silhouette of woman dressed in white near the trinity.<ref name="mireasa" />
== Dolj County == * '''Radovan Forest''' – Dozens of people, especially men, have drowned over time in Lake Fântânele of Radovan. Locals put numerous tragedies on account of the curse of a bride, who legend says that in the 1940s hanged herself in the forest surrounding the lake.<ref name="mireasa" /> Her story has two versions: one, according to that a young Moldovan woman arrived in [[Oltenia]] with her family, would have committed suicide after her husband was beaten to death on the night of the wedding;<ref>{{Cite web|url = http://www.unica.ro/articol/locuri-bantuite-romania-6731|title = 4 locuri bântuite din România|date = 31 August 2010|accessdate = |website = unica.ro|publisher = |last = Chivu|first = Erika|language = Romanian}}</ref> the second version says that she has committed suicide after, even before the wedding, would have been raped by a kulak that employed her.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://adevarul.ro/locale/craiova/legenda-fantomei-padurea-radovan-judetul-doljmireasa-radovan-razbuna-cei-vii-lasarea-intunericului-1_511b3e3c344a78211834bdfc/index.html |title=Legenda fantomei din pădurea Radovan din județul Dolj. "Mireasa din Radovan" se răzbună pe cei vii după lăsarea întunericului |work=Adevărul |author=Andreea Mitrache |date=13 February 2013 |language=Romanian}}</ref> Locals say the bride haunts the road near the forest, and the passers are advised to move quickly and try to simply overlook any sound or appearance, otherwise the bride will lead them in the heart of the forest, from where they won't ever return.<ref name="mireasa" /> * '''Bulzești commune''' Villagers talk about the "creatures by the hill". A long time ago, the village was moved because of the [[strigoi]]. According to a villager:"The evil spirits haunt us at both day and night. Nobody dares to go up the hill because of the vampires. A neighbour has paralyzed many years ago when he bumped into one of the evil spirits. He couldn't find his peace and does bad things to all those around him" The Romanian poet [[Marin Sorescu]], born in the commune, mentioned the legend in his poem "Dumneata": One night, here, by the fountains, / Where homes are rare, due to the ghosts / Who they say have showed around / And the people were strained to put houses there, for the ghosts to have their place.(...)<ref>http://adevarul.ro/locale/craiova/cele-mai-bantuite-locuri-dolj-mireasa-radovan-razbuna-cei-vii-strigoii-comuna-poetului-marin-sorescu-1_5607bbfbf5eaafab2c0c6159/index.html</ref>
== Iași County == * '''House of Gavril Buzatu on Manta Roșie''' – In this house from [[Iași]] lived Gavril Buzatu, "the last executioner of Moldova".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://adevarul.ro/locale/iasi/miturile-urbane-iasului-legenda-ultimului-calau-iasi-namila-suflet-bantuita-strigoi-fantome-1_511b46e7344a78211834ec57/index.html |title=Miturile urbane ale Iașului. Legenda ultimului călău din Moldova, o "namilă" al cărei suflet este bântuit de strigoi și fantome |work=Adevărul |author=Ionuț Benea |date=13 February 2013 |language=Romanian}}</ref> The house was the site of several killings and atrocities.<ref name="calaul">{{cite web |url=http://www.barfadeiasi.ro/facebook-mania/stafiile-din-casa-calaului-de-pe-manta-rosie/ |title=Stafiile din casa călăului, de pe Manta Roșie |work=Bârfa de Iași |date=13 January 2012 |language=Romanian}}</ref> It is reportedly haunted by [[strigoi]] about people think would be the thieves beheaded by Gavril Buzatu. During the night can be heard howls of beast or human, followed by roars of laughter. Here can be seen strange lights that "run" through the mansion, especially during the winter. A former tenant reported a black creature running through the nearby forest. Likewise, were seen flames lighting up suddenly in the abandoned salons.<ref name="calaul" /> * '''Lungani Hill''' – It is said that the hill that separates the villages of [[Goești]] and [[Brăești, Iași|Brăești]] is haunted by thousands of ghosts of soldiers from the [[World War I]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://observator.tv/social/povestea-batalionului-de-stafii-de-pe-dealul-lunganilor-104556.html |title=Povestea batalionului de stafii de pe Dealul Lunganilor |work=Observator.tv |date=10 July 2013 |language=Romanian}}</ref> Locals reported white lights, silhouettes of soldiers descending from the cemetery into the valley, at night, late after 12 o'clock. On the other side of the hill, in the commune of [[Lungani]], peasants saw headless people who went on the road<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.romaniatv.net/romania-mistica-dealul-lunganilor-si-povestea-soldatilor-fantoma_62603.html |title=ROMÂNIA MISTICĂ. Dealul Lunganilor și povestea soldaților-fantomă |work=România TV |author=Narcisa Tomulescu |date=19 January 2013 |language=Romanian}}</ref> or even the devil in the body of child or cat.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bzi.ro/foto-video-fantomele-de-pe-dealul-goestilor-186996 |title=Fantomele de pe Dealul Goeștilor |work=Bună Ziua Iași |author=Constantin Mazilu |date=9 September 2010 |language=Romanian}}</ref>
== Maramureș County == * '''E58 near [[Cicârlău]]''' – The area is known by drivers as one where many accidents happen. The accidents are attributed to a ghost which is said that comes out from the crops and scares the drivers. In 1930s, a young woman named Pălăguța, envied by women for her beauty, was accused of [[witchcraft]] and beaten to death.<ref name="cicarlau">{{cite web |url=http://www.glasul.ro/view_article.php?show=4016&name=Horoscopul_zilei) |title=Fantoma din Cicârlău |work=Glasul Maramureșului |author=Doina Ferenț |date=19 January 2009 |language=Romanian}}</ref> Old people speak about a kind of animal with very long legs which haunted the village in Tuesday nights. It is said that appeared after midnight and went to houses where women violated the church rule. Women would have been hit in the temple and died or remained paralyzed.<ref name="cicarlau" />
== Prahova County == [[File:Iulia Hasdeu Castle.jpg|thumb|200px|[[Iulia Hasdeu Castle]]]] * '''[[Iulia Hasdeu Castle]] in [[Câmpina]]''' – Bizarre by its architecture, Iulia Hasdeu Castle was built by writer [[Bogdan Petriceicu Hasdeu]] in the memory of [[Iulia Hasdeu]], his daughter, who died at age 19. It is said that the castle was built in accordance with the indications received during some [[seance]]s, from his dead daughter. Locals say that during the night, Iulia Hasdeu can be heard playing the piano, in father's applause.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://stiri.tvr.ro/mister-si-groaza-romania-tara-castelelor-si-conacelor-bantuite_47824.html |title=Mister şi groază: România, ţara castelelor şi conacelor bântuite |work=Ştirile TVR |date=23 July 2014 |language=Romanian}}</ref>
== See also == * [[List of reportedly haunted locations in the world]] * [[List of ghosts]]
== External links == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20141022153527/http://www.locuribantuite.ro/ Locuri Bântuite], a website dedicated to all haunted locations in Romania
== References == {{Reflist|2}}
{{Ghosts|state=collapsed}}

revision.text:
{{infobox Organization |name = Монголын радио сонирхогчдын холбоо
Mongolian Amateur Radio Society |image = MARS_logo.png |image_border = |size = 71px |caption = |map = |msize = |mcaption = |abbreviation = MARS |motto = |formation = |extinction = |type = [[Non-profit organization]] |status = |purpose = Advocacy, Education |headquarters = |location = [[Ulan Bator]], [[Mongolia]] |region_served = [[Mongolia]] |membership = |language = [[Mongolian language|Mongolian]] |leader_title = President |leader_name = |main_organ = |affiliations = |num_staff = |budget = |website = http://www.qsl.net/jt1kaa/ |remarks = }} The '''Mongolian Amateur Radio Society''' ('''MARS''') (in [[Mongolian language|Mongolian]], '''Монголын радио сонирхогчдын холбоо''') is a national [[non-profit organization]] for [[amateur radio]] enthusiasts in [[Mongolia]]. Key membership benefits of MARS include the sponsorship of [[amateur radio operating award]]s and radio [[contesting|contests]].Mongolian Amateur Radio Society (2008). [http://www.qsl.net/jt1kaa/ Mongolian Amateur Radio Society] official web site. Retrieved Aug. 13, 2008. In the spring of 2008, MARS purported to be a successor organization to the [[Mongolian Radio Sport Federation]], and supplied the [[International Amateur Radio Union]] with documentation regarding a name change and updated organizational constitution. The name change from Mongolian Radio Sports Federation to Mongolian Amateur Radio Society was recognized by the IARU Region I Executive Committee at its April, 2008 meeting.International Amateur Radio Union Region 1 (2008). [http://www.crk.cz/FILES/EC2008.PDF Executive Committee Meeting 5-7 April 2008]. ¶7. Member Society Issues: Mongolia. Subsequent to that meeting, the IARU determined that the name change documentation was not authorized by the Mongolian Radio Sport Federation, which had in fact not changed its name or constitution, and continued to exist as a separate organization. The IARU currently recognizes the MRSF as the IARU member society representing Mongolia.International Amateur Radio Union (2008). [http://www.iaru.org/iaru-soc.html "Member Societies"]. Retrieved Aug. 1, 2008. == See also == *[[Mongolian Radio Sport Federation]] == References == {{reflist}} {{Mongolia-stub}} {{Asia-org-stub}} {{Amateur-radio-stub}} [[Category:Clubs and societies in Mongolia]]

revision.comment: removed [[Category:Neuroscience research centers]]; added [[Category:Neuroscience research centers in Canada]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
revision.text:
{{COI|date=October 2009}} {| class="infobox" style="width: 23em; font-size: 95%;" |+ style="font-size: larger;" | |- ! colspan="2" bgcolor="#b0c4de" | '''National Core for Neuroethics''' |- style="vertical-align: top;" |- | Name | ''National Core for Neuroethics'' |- | Logo | [[Image:National Core For Neuroethics Logo.svg|130px]] |- | Region | Vancouver |- | Province | British Columbia |- | Country | Canada |- | Coordinates | {{Coord|49|15|40|N|123|07|28|W|scale:5000_type:landmark_region:CA-BC|display=inline,title|name=Vancouver Hospital and Health Sciences Centre}} |- | Type | Research |- | Speciality | Neuroethics |- | Affiliation | [[UBC Faculty of Medicine]] |- | Established | 2007 |- | Website | http://www.neuroethicscanada.ca |- |}
The '''National Core for Neuroethics''' at the [[University of British Columbia]] was established in August 2007, with support from the [[Canadian Institutes of Health Research]], the Institute of Mental Health and Addiction, the [[Canada Foundation for Innovation]], the British Columbia Knowledge Development Fund, the [[Canada Research Chair]]s program, the UBC Brain Research Centre and the UBC Institute of Mental Health.<ref name="neuroethics.ubc.ca">http://www.neuroethics.ubc.ca/index.html</ref> Co-founded by [[Judy Illes]] and [[Peter Reiner]], the Core studies [[neuroethics]], with particular focus on ethics in [[neurodegenerative disease]] and [[regenerative medicine]], international and cross-cultural challenges in brain research, [[neuroimaging]] and [[ethics]], the neuroethics of [[Human enhancement|enhancement]], and [[personalized medicine]].<ref>http://www.neuroethics.ubc.ca/research.html</ref>
The Core's major research projects are focused on the use of drugs and devices for [[neuroenhancement]], ethics in neurodegenerative disease and regenerative medicine research, brain research, neuroimaging in the private sector, and the ethics of personalized medicine, among others. Members of the Core also lead initiatives aside from their research projects.
Considerable attention has been given to the Core by both the scholarly and non-academic media, with the Core featured in ''[[The New York Times]]'',<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/2008/09/15/world/asia/15brainscan.html?_r=1&pagewanted=all "India's novel use of brain scans in courts is debated]. New York Times, September 2008.</ref>{{Dubious|date=October 2009}} the ''[[Vancouver Sun]]'',<ref>Illes, J. [http://www2.canada.com/vancouversun/news/editorial/story.html?id=b663ac5e-c773-4d64-afd5-9c9c8ecbb7ec "The perilous pursuit of perfection: Neuroscience has been used to provide athletes a mental edge, but it raises ethical issues."] The Vancouver Sun, 8 September 2008. [an editorial by the Core's leader]</ref> on the ''[[Canwest]] Global Newshour'',<ref>Post-traumatic stress drug. The News Hour, Global BC, November 2008.</ref> and in the journal ''[[Science (journal)|Science]]'',<ref>Retention's the thing. Science, August 2008.</ref> amongst others. As an effort to engage the public in neuroethics discussion, the Core has recently started an online blog.<ref>http://neuroethicscanada.wordpress.com</ref>
== Mission == The National Core for Neuroethics strives to "tackle the ethical, legal, policy and social implications of frontier [[neuroscience]] through high impact research, education and outreach to ensure the close alignment of innovation and human values".<ref name="Lau P. 2008">Lau P., Chahal, N. Lombera, S. National Core for Neuroethics Annual Report 2007-2008. 2008, Vancouver, BC.</ref> [[Image:National Core for Neuroethics Plaque.JPG|thumb|National Core for Neuroethics]]
== People == The Core is led by [[Judy Illes]], PhD, Canada Research Chair in Neuroethics and Professor of Neurology at the University of British Columbia.<ref name="neuroethics.ubc.ca">http://www.neuroethics.ubc.ca/people.html</ref>
[[Peter Reiner]], VMD, PhD, Professor of Psychiatry at the University of British Columbia, is a Senior Faculty Member with the Core.<ref name="neuroethics.ubc.ca"/>
== Funding == [[Image:Core Inauguration- Judy Illes.JPG|thumb|National Core for Neuroethics Inauguration]] The Core receives financial support from the [[Canadian Institutes of Health Research]], Institute of Mental Health and Addiction, [[Canada Foundation for Innovation]], the British Columbia Knowledge Development Fund, the [[Canada Research Chair]]s program, the UBC Brain Research Centre, the UBC Institute of Mental Health, the [[National Institutes of Health]], the [[Vancouver Coastal Health]] Research Institute, the British Columbia Rural and Remote Health Research Network, the Harvard NeuroDiscovery Center's Foundation for Ethics and Biotechnology, the North Growth Foundation, the Greenwall Foundation, the Stem Cell Network, the [[Dana Foundation]], the Canadian Dementia Knowledge Translation Network, and [[Imperial Oil]].<ref name="neuroethics.ubc.ca"/>
== Inauguration == In September 2008, the Core celebrated its first anniversary with an inauguration celebration held at the [[Chan Centre for the Performing Arts]] at the University of British Columbia. In attendance were international dignitaries in the field of neuroethics, including [[Joseph Fins]] (Chief of the Division of Medical Ethics at Weill Cornell Medical College),<ref>http://www.weillcornell.org/jfins/</ref> Dr. [[Barbara Sahakian]] (Professor of Clinical Neuropsychology at the Department of Psychiatry, University of Cambridge School of Clinical Medicine),<ref>http://www.psychiatry.cam.ac.uk/pages/profiles/sahakian.html</ref> Eric Racine (Director, [[Neuroethics Research Unit]], Institut de recherches cliniques de Montréal),<ref>http://www.ircm.qc.ca/en/recherche/statique/unite46.html</ref> and Dr. [[Rémi Quirion]] (Scientific Director, Institute of Neurosciences, Mental Health and Addiction (INMHA)).<ref>http://www.cihr-irsc.gc.ca/e/9592.html</ref>
== References == {{Reflist}}
== External links == '''Neuroethics Research Centres''' * [http://neuroethicscanada.ca National Core for Neuroethics] * [http://neuroethics.stanford.edu/ Neuroethics Imaging Group, Stanford Center for Biomedical Ethics] * [http://www.ircm.qc.ca/LARECHERCHE/axes/neuro/neuroethique/Pages/index.aspx?PFLG=1033 Neuroethics Research Unit] * [http://www.noveltechethics.ca/site_neuro.php NovelTechEthics] * [http://neuroethics.upenn.edu/ Neuroethics.upenn.edu] * [http://ccn.upenn.edu/ The Center for Cognitive Neuroscience, University of Pennsylvania]
'''Neuroethics blogs''' * [http://neuroethicscanada.wordpress.com Neuroethics at the Core blog] * [http://kolber.typepad.com Neuroethics and Law blog] * [http://brainethics.wordpress.com BrainEthics blog]
'''Neuroethics journals''' * ''[https://www.springer.com/12152 Neuroethics]'' * ''[http://www.bioethics.net/journal/ The American Journal of Bioethics]'' * [http://www.asbh.org/ The American Society for Bioethics and Humanities] * [http://virtualmentor.ama-assn.org/2004/08/rdng1-0408.html Virtual Mentor Ethics Journal of the American Medical Association Theme Issue: Ethical Issues in Neuroscience]
'''Neuroethics societies''' * [http://www.cogneurosociety.org/ Cognitive Neuroscience Society] * [[International Neuroethics Society]] ([http://www.neuroethicssociety.org Website])
'''Neuroethics literature databases''' * [http://www.neuroethik.ifzn.uni-mainz.de/index.php?id=2&L=1 neuroethics.uni-mainz.de Portal for Neuroethics] * [http://www.neuroethics.ubc.ca/publications.html National Core for Neuroethics at the University of British Columbia Publications Page]
'''Neuroethics resources''' * [http://bioethics.od.nih.gov/ Bioethics Resources from the NIH] * [http://faculty.washington.edu/chudler/neurok.html Neuroscience for Kids: Neuroethics] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20080916023939/http://www.bioethics.gov/ The President's Council on Bioethics]

revision.comment: Removed deprecated parameter(s) from [[Template:Columns-list]] using [[User:DeprecatedFixerBot| DeprecatedFixerBot]]. Questions? See [[Template:Div col#Usage of "cols" parameter]] or [[User talk:TheSandDoctor|msg TSD!]] (please mention that this is task #2!))
revision.text:
[[File:Petzel_shapes.jpeg|thumb|right|170 px|''The Shapes Project'' by artist [[Allan McCollum]]]] [[File:LekayUntitled1991.jpg|thumb|right|170 px|[[John LeKay]] ''Untitled'', 1991, ladder and wheelchair]] '''Neo-conceptual art''' describes art practices in the 1980s and particularly 1990s to date that derive from the [[conceptual art]] movement of the 1960s and 1970s. These subsequent initiatives have included the [[Moscow Conceptualists]], United States neo-conceptualists such as [[Sherrie Levine]] and the [[Young British Artists]], notably [[Damien Hirst]] and [[Tracey Emin]] in the [[United Kingdom]], where there is also a [[Stuckism]] counter-movement and criticism from the 1970s conceptual art group [[Art and Language]].
==History==
[[File:Neon-bolognini.JPG|thumb|right|170 px|[[Maurizio Bolognini]]'s ''Programmed Machines'' (''Sealed'') hundreds of computers are programmed to generate endless flows of random images which nobody would see. <ref>{{citation | title=Maurizio Bolognini. Programmed Machines 1990-2005 | year=2005 | author=S. Solimano (ed.) | publisher=Villa Croce Museum of Contemporary Art, Neos | location=Genoa | isbn=88-87262-47-0 }}.</ref>]] Many of the concerns of the "conceptual art" movement proper have been taken up by many contemporary artists since the initial wave of conceptual artists. While many of these artists may not term themselves "conceptual artists", ideas such as anti-commodification, social and/or political critique, [[digital art]], and ideas/information as medium continue to be aspects of contemporary art, especially among artists working with [[computer art]], [[installation art]], [[performance art]], [[net.art]] and [[electronic art]]. Many critics and artists may speak of conceptual aspects of a given artist or art work, reflecting the enduring influence that many of the original conceptual artists have had on the art world.
==New York City== The idea of neo-conceptual art (sometimes later termed [[post-conceptual art]]) in the United States was clearly articulated by [[Tricia Collins]] and [[Richard Milazzo]] (working as a team called: Collins & Milazzo) in the early 1980s in New York City,<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/1989/02/19/arts/art-now-on-view-new-work-by-freelance-curators.html?pagewanted=all&src=pm ART; Now on View, New Work by Freelance Curators]</ref> when they brought to prominence a whole new generation of artists through their copious writings and curatorial activity. It was their exhibitions and writings that originally fashioned the theoretical context for a new kind of neo (or post) conceptual art; one that argued simultaneously against [[Neo-Expressionism]] and Picture-Theory Art.<ref>[http://www.thefreelibrary.com/DAN+CAMERON+ON+Collins+%26+Milazzo.-a057475774] DAN CAMERON ON Collins & Milazzo</ref> It was through this context that the work of many of the artists associated with Neo-Conceptualism (or what some of the critics reductively called “Simulationism” and “Neo Geo”) was first brought together: artists such as [[Ross Bleckner]], [[James Welling]], [[Steven Parrino]], [[Richard Prince]], [[Peter Nagy (artist)|Peter Nagy]], [[Joseph Nechvatal]], [[Sarah Charlesworth]], [[Mark Innerst]], [[Allan McCollum]], [[Peter Halley]], [[Jonathan Lasker]], [[Haim Steinbach]], [[Philip Taaffe]], [[Robert Gober]] and [[Saint Clair Cemin]].
==Moscow== The [[Moscow Conceptualists]], in the 1970s and 80s, attempted to subvert socialist ideology using the strategies of [[conceptual art]] and [[appropriation art]]. The central figures were [[Ilya Kabakov]] and [[Komar and Melamid]]. The group also included [[Eric Bulatov]] and [[Viktor Pivovarov]].
==London== The [[Young British Artists]] (YBAs), led by [[Damien Hirst]], came to prominence in the 1990s and their work was described at the time as neo-conceptual,<ref>Scott Lash and Celia Lury, ''Global Culture Industries: The Mediation of Things'', Polity, 2007, p211. {{ISBN|0-7456-2483-9}}</ref> even though it relies very heavily on the art object to make its impact. The term is used in relation to them on the basis that the object is not the artwork, or is often a [[Found art|found object]], which has not needed artistic skill in its production. [[Tracey Emin]] is seen as a leading YBA and a neo-conceptualist, even though she has denied that she is and has emphasised personal emotional expression. Charles Harrison, a member of the conceptual art group [[Art and Language]] in the 1970s, criticizes the neo-conceptual art of the 1990s as conceptual art "without threat or awkwardness"<ref>Charles Harrison, ''Essays on Art & Language'', MIT Press, 2001, p29. {{ISBN|0-262-58241-4}}</ref> and a "vacant" prospect.<ref>Charles Harrison, ''Essays on Art & Language'', MIT Press, 2001, p241. {{ISBN|0-262-58241-4}}</ref> Other notable artists associated with neo-conceptualism in the UK include [[Martin Creed]], [[Liam Gillick]], [[Bethan Huws]], [[Simon Patterson (artist)|Simon Patterson]], [[Simon Starling]] and [[Douglas Gordon]].
==Notable events== 1991: [[Charles Saatchi]] funds Damien Hirst and the next year in the [[Saatchi Gallery]] exhibits his ''[[The Physical Impossibility of Death in the Mind of Someone Living]]'', a shark in formaldehyde in a vitrine.
1993: [[Vanessa Beecroft]] holds her first performance in Milan, Italy, using models to act as a second audience to the display of her diary of food.
1999: [[Tracey Emin]] is nominated for the [[Turner Prize]]. Part of her exhibit is ''My Bed'', her dishevelled bed, surrounded by detritus such as condoms, blood-stained knickers, bottles and her bedroom slippers.
2001: [[Martin Creed]] wins the Turner Prize for ''The Lights Going On and Off'', an empty room where the lights go on and off.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/arts/1698032.stm BBC Online]</ref>
2005: [[Simon Starling]] wins the Turner Prize for ''Shedboatshed'', a wooden shed which he had turned into a boat, floated down the Rhine and turned back into a shed again.<ref>[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,2-1905555,00.html ''The Times'']</ref>
==Controversy in the UK== In [[United Kingdom|Britain]], the rise to prominence of the [[Young British Artists]] (YBAs) after the 1988 ''[[Freeze (exhibition)|Freeze]]'' show, curated by Damien Hirst, and subsequent promotion of the group by the [[Saatchi Gallery]] during the 1990s, generated a media backlash, where the phrases "conceptual art" and "neo-conceptual" came to be terms of derision applied to much [[contemporary art]]. This was amplified by the [[Turner Prize]] whose more extreme nominees (most notably Hirst and Emin) caused a controversy annually.
[[File:Stuckists Death of Conceptual Art demo (3).jpg|thumb|right|170 px|[[Stuckism|Stuckists']] "Death of Conceptual Art" coffin demonstration, 2002]] The [[Stuckism|Stuckist]] group of artists, founded in 1999, proclaimed themselves "pro-contemporary figurative painting with ideas and anti-conceptual art, mainly because of its lack of concepts." They also called it pretentious, "unremarkable and boring" and on July 25, 2002 deposited a coffin outside the [[White Cube]] gallery, marked "The Death of Conceptual Art".<ref>[http://www.stuckism.com/Tate/WhiteCube.html "White Cube Demo 2002"], stuckism.com. Retrieved 19 April 2008.</ref><ref>Cripps, Charlotte. [http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qn4158/is_20040907/ai_n12797891 "Visual arts: Saying knickers to Sir Nicholas], ''[[The Independent]]'', 7 September 2004. Retrieved from findarticles.com, 7 April 2008.</ref> They staged yearly demonstrations outside the Turner Prize.
In 2002, [[Ivan Massow]], the Chairman of the [[Institute of Contemporary Arts]] branded conceptual art "pretentious, self-indulgent, craftless tat" and in "danger of disappearing up its own arse ... led by cultural tsars such as the [[Tate Gallery|Tate]]'s Sir [[Nicholas Serota]].<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/uk_news/story/0,3604,634797,00.html ''The Guardian'']</ref> Massow was consequently forced to resign. At the end of the year, the Culture Minister, [[Kim Howells]] (an art school graduate) denounced the Turner Prize as "cold, mechanical, conceptual bullshit".<ref>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/main.jhtml?xml=/news/2002/11/01/nart01.xml ''The Daily Telegraph'']</ref>
In October 2004 the [[Saatchi Gallery]] told the media that "painting continues to be the most relevant and vital way that artists choose to communicate."<ref>Reynolds, Nigel 2004 [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/main.jhtml?xml=/news/2004/10/02/nsaat02.xml "Saatchi's latest shock for the art world is – painting"] ''The Daily Telegraph'' 10 February 2004. Accessed April 15, 2006</ref> Following this [[Charles Saatchi]] began to sell prominent works from his YBA collection.
==See also== {{columns-list|colwidth=18em| * [[Conceptual art]] * [[Appropriation art]] * [[Institutional Critique]] * [[Postmodern art]] * [[Art software]] * [[Computer art]] * [[Internet art]] * [[Electronic art]] * [[Systems art]] * [[Superflat]] * [[Superstroke]] * [[Cyberarts]] * [[New media]] * [[Interactive film]] * [[New media art]] * [[Computer generated music]] * [[Generative art]] * [[Stuckist demonstrations]] }}
==Notes and references== {{reflist|2}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Neo-conceptual art}} [[Category:Contemporary art]] [[Category:Art movements]] [[Category:Conceptual art]] [[Category:Postmodern art]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Paul Fillunger | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_date = June 25, 1883 | birth_place = [[Vienna]], [[Austria]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1937|03|07|1883|06|25}} | death_place = Vienna, Austria | education = | occupation = [[Geotechnical engineer]] | spouse = | parents = | children = }}
'''Paul Fillunger''' (June 25, 1883 in Vienna – March 7, 1937 in Vienna) was an [[Austrians|Austrian]] [[Geotechnical engineering|geotechnical engineer]].
Raised in a family of engineers, he studied at the [[Technical University of Vienna|Technische Hochschule]] in [[Vienna]] and took a position in the [[Imperial Royal Austrian State Railways|state-owned railway company]] in 1906. In 1908 he completed a PhD and then went to teach mathematics, [[machine industry]] and then mechanics at the [[University of Vienna]].
Fillunger pioneered the study of saturated ground and was made famous by an article published in 1913.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.springerlink.com/content/wl52330244074778/ |title=Development of porous media theories — A brief historical review |first=R. |last=De Boer |journal=Transport in Porous Media | date=October 1992 |volume=9 |number=1-2 |pages=155–164}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |title=Der Auftrieb in Talsperren |journal=Österreichische Wochenschrift für den öffentlichen Baudienst |volume=19 |year=1913 |pages=532, 567}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |title=Neuere Grundlagen für die statische Berechnung von Talsperren |journal=Zeitschrift des Österreichischen Ingenieur - und Architektenvereins |volume=23 |year=1914 |page=441}}</ref>
He discovered the difference in behaviors of the effective and general stresses in samples of ground, opening the way for further research. He is considered to be a pioneer of the theory of liquid-saturated [[Porous medium|porous solids]].<ref>{{cite book|last=Boer|first=Reint|title=The Engineer And The Scandal: A Piece Of Science History|edition=Springer|year=2005|isbn=9783540231110|page=155}}</ref>
Fillunger's theories put him in heated conflict with [[Karl von Terzaghi]], who is often referred to as "father of [[soil mechanics]]", whom Fillunger was accused of slandering. The University blamed Fillunger, who then committed suicide by opening the gas jets in the bathroom<ref>[https://books.google.com/books?id=WQDXM5pgx-AC&pg=PA32&lpg=PA32&dq=%22Paul+Fillunger%22+suicide&source=bl&ots=WYlqxihv4s&sig=3PFL6e-fnmU_vUV7hzZlPzjn-Rc&hl=en&sa=X&ei=19_-UNWrCKf00QGg54DwDQ&ved=0CBsQ6AEwAg Dimitrios Kolymbas - ''Constitutive Modelling of Granular Materials'' p. 32]</ref> with his wife.
== References == <references /> * Reint Boer, ''The Engineer And The Scandal: A Piece Of Science History'', Springer, 2005 * Paul Fillunger, "Erdbaumechanik?", Vienna, 1936
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Fillunger, Paul}} [[Category:Geotechnical engineers]] [[Category:Austrian civil engineers]] [[Category:Scientists from Vienna]] [[Category:1883 births]] [[Category:1937 deaths]] [[Category:Joint suicides]] [[Category:Suicides in Austria]] [[Category:Scientific controversies]] [[Category:Male suicides]]
